head.title: Home - School District of Indian River County

meta.content: The School District of Indian River County is located approximately halfway down the east coast of Florida. Our district has 13 elementary schools, 4 middle schools, 2 high schools, one alternative education center, one career and adult education center, one exceptional student education school, and 5 charter schools. Our graduation rate for 2017-2018 school year was 92%.

Please join us for our “Drive By and Say Hi Pep Rally!” All of our schools, departments, and district office staff members will gather at the mall on Friday, May 1st for our “Drive By and Say Hi Pep Rally.” Schools will have

a.title: Ripple Effects: Social Emotional Learning Tool Available Online

img.alt: Ripple Effects: Social Emotional Learning Tool Available Online

div.div: Ripple Effects: Social Emotional Learning Tool Available Online

Ripple Effects is a Social Emotional learning program for students (grades 3-12) that promotes skills like self-awareness & self-management that may be especially helpful during this challenging time.
Our Spirit Week is Monday 4/13 through Friday 4/17. Show us your SDIRC Spirit by posting pictures on social media with the hashtag #SDIRCSpirit! Visit our website for more information.
Following the recommendations of the CDC, Health Department, and Florida Department of Education our School Choice Expo on 3/14 has been CANCELED

a.title: 'Stop the Bleed' Kits Donated to District

img.alt: 'Stop the Bleed' Kits Donated to District

div.div: 'Stop the Bleed' Kits Donated to District

Last year, the Vero Beach Elks Lodge and the Sebastian Elks Lodge donated 32 "Stop the Bleed" kits to the Indian River County School District. Stop the Bleed Kits are specifically designed to treat traumatic injuries, and we

a.title: The SDIRC Positive Climate & Discipline Advisory Team is Forming Now!

img.alt: The SDIRC Positive Climate & Discipline Advisory Team is Forming Now!

div.div: The SDIRC Positive Climate & Discipline Advisory Team is Forming Now!

The School District of Indian River County invites stakeholders to join the Positive Climate and Discipline Advisory Team (PCDAT). The purpose of the PCDAT members will be to review and provide input for the revision of the P

a.title: Don't Miss the Piper Aircraft Apprentice Program Information Session on Jan. 15 at 6:00

img.alt: Don't Miss the Piper Aircraft Apprentice Program Information Session on Jan. 15 at 6:00

div.div: Don't Miss the Piper Aircraft Apprentice Program Information Session on Jan. 15 at 6:00

Piper Aircraft will be hosting an informational session for prospective apprentices (parents / guardians and significant others welcome) on Wednesday, January 15, 2020 at 6:00 p.m. at the Piper Aircraft factory in Vero Beach.

a.title: Congratulations to Our 2019-2020 High Impact Grant Winners!

img.alt: Congratulations to Our 2019-2020 High Impact Grant Winners!

div.div: Congratulations to Our 2019-2020 High Impact Grant Winners!

Congratulations to our 2019-2020 High Impact Grant Winners! We are looking forward to seeing the outcomes of the projects and ideas that the High Impact Grants are enabling! Thank you to the Education Foundation of Indian Riv

Out of the three days that were missed due to Hurricane Dorian, the Governor waived one day, and, as pre-determined "emergency days" on our SDIRC instructional calendar, the Board voted to use November 25th and November 26th
Join us as we set a meeting timeline and assemble the 2020-2021 Instructional Calendar Committee. Your input is important!

blockquote.a: School District of Indian River County

div.h2: The SDIRC Mobile App is Live!

div.div: SDIRC is excited to announce that we are working with community partners to make sure our community is counted in the upcoming 2020 Census. You can find information about the Census and how to make sure we're all counted by clicking here.
Click to learn more about the Florida Empowerment Scholarships.
Learn about the Reading Scholarships available to students by visiting the Step Up For Students website.
Reporting bullying, cyberbullying, or harassment is the first step toward making our schools in Indian River County a safe place for everyone.
Learn about the Instructional Materials Adoption timeline, procedures, and meetings.

This summer, the Florida Department of Education has a unique opportunity to take a look at career and technical education as it is offered in the State of Florida. Visit our CTE page for more information.

The Economic Security Report provides students, parents, and others with information on graduates of Florida's public institutions of higher education. Click to read the Executive Summary and the Full Report.
Visit the Florida Auditor General webpage for a listing of all reports issued by the Auditor General for Indian River County District School Board.

a.title: The Florida Department of Education Wants Your Input

img.alt: The Florida Department of Education Wants Your Input

div.div: The Florida Department of Education Wants Your Input
The Florida Department of Education Wants Your Input
The Florida Department of Education wants to hear from you. Click to take the survey and find out information about Executive Order 19-32.

Our Strategic Plan is a five-year plan created using the input from our students, parents, employees, business partners, and community members, highlighting five main goal areas that were identified as being vital for a thriving school system. Click to learn more.

We are pleased to announce that the FortifyFL app is LIVE. Now, any student, educator, parent, or member of the public can report school safety concerns directly to law enforcement and school administrators anonymously and easily through the FortifyFL app or www.getfortifyfl.com.
Rise Up IRC's mission is reaching individual students everyday through united partnerships. Register to become a mentor to a student to foster early literacy success.
In an effort to save resources and time required by school staff to sort and handle flyers, approved flyers are posted in the Virtual Backpack.
